Miles Sound System SDK 6.6h

AIL_quick_set_low_pass_cut_off

The function AIL_quick_set_low_pass_cut_off applies a low pass filter to the digital audio sample.

void AIL_quick_set_low_pass_cut_off(
  HAUDIO audio,
  F32 cut_off
);

In Parameters

audio
specifies the audio handle that you wish to control (must be a digital handle).
cut_off
specifies the low pass filter cut-off level. The range is 0.0 to 1.0 as a scale of the sample's nyquist rate (which is half the sample rate). For example, if you have a 44100 Hz sample, then the nyquist rate is 22050 Hz. If you then set a 0.5 cut off, only frequencies under 11025 Hz will be heard.

Note that the Xbox's low pass filter hardware is limited to 30 Hz to 8000 Hz.

Discussion

This function allows you to set a low pass filter on any digital sample (whether uncompressed or compressed). A low pass filter only lets frequencies below the cut-off frequency to be heard.

The default low pass cut-off is 1.0 (allowing all frequencies to pass).

The range is 0.0 to 1.0 as a scale of the sample's nyquist rate (which is half the sample rate). For example, if you have a 44100 Hz sample, then the nyquist rate is 22050 Hz. If you then set a 0.5 cut off, only frequencies under 11025 Hz will be heard.

There is almost no CPU hit at all with this filter. There is no CPU hit at all on the Xbox, but the hardware low pass filter only supports frequencies from 30 to 8000 Hz.
